programme.title: Flavor on the Fly
programme.desc: Welcome to Flavor on the FlyIn the first installment of our newest original series, Chef Ranga Perera trades the towering Rockies for the rolling hills in the Green Mountain State. Out of his element and on a mission to find inspiration for new dishes that embody both the spirit of Vermont and his Sri Lankan roots, Ranga meets with a myriad of enthusiastic characters; each eager to share a small slice of the place they call home. Perch nuggets, sharp teeth, and hot peppers - see what lies in store for our host in the first-ever episode of Flavor on the Fly.

programme.title: Flavor on the Fly
programme.desc: When it comes to the Northeast, Maine stands out as a unparalleled destination. With its rugged coastline, fresh seafood straight from the Atlantic, and charming small towns, there's no place quite like it. In this episode of Flavor on the Fly, Ranga digs deep into his Sri Lankan roots to come up with a seafood curry dish like none other. Inspired by time spent with good friends, fly fishing for both smallmouth and striped bass, and harvesting local shellfish, this tour through the Pine Tree State results in a one-of-a-kind dish that gives cooking with local ingredients a whole new meaning. Follow as we crack open the shell of one of the most intricate and diverse fisheries Ranga has ever explored.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Highlighting guests Dalton Smith; Dalton coached Campbellsville University Kayak Bass Team. Fished high school in KY; Mark watched him as a youth angle. Dalton caught two 14lb+ bass on the same day once. The 23-year-old uprooted from his area to follow this dream full time in OH.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Mark is with guest and great friend Jimmy Jennings. Jimmy helped get The Direction, Marks dream of filming outdoor TV, to reality. His team at One Call Concepts supported Marks idea of delivering The Call 811, the national call before you dig number and safe digging message, to the outdoor viewer thru outdoor TV a reality. It was Marks dream as a kit to host an outdoor show. Jimmy and his team took a risk that the show would take off and it did. Now airing on multiple outdoor networks and digital distribution platforms, Jimmys belief and Marks crazy dream has taken the safe digging message to tens of millions of viewers over the last 9 years. Listen to these two reminisce on past fishing trips and watch as they go to one of Marks favorite fishing lakes in KY for some crazy fall largemouth bass fishing action!

programme.title: Redemption

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: A Las Vegas bodyguard with a gambling addiction takes on the gangster who attacked his friend, landing him deep in trouble with the city's mob.

programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh leads an all-star cast in an adaptation of Shakespeare's great tragedy - the story of Hamlet.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: In one of Scotlands best-ever comedies, an oil tycoon sends a man to an odd, enchanting coastal town to grab land rights, but nothing goes as planned.

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Neurotic conman Roy and his protg Frank find their latest scam disrupted when Roy discovers he has a teen daughter who wants to meet him.

programme.title: One Crazy Summer
programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.title: The Spitfire Grill
programme.desc: A woman transforms a ramshackle local restaurant, winning the hearts of townspeopleuntil tragedy strikes.

programme.title: Joe Versus the Volcano
programme.desc: A corporate drone receives life-altering news, and agrees to a tycoons odd request to travel halfway around the world and jump into a volcano.

programme.title: Ladyhawke
programme.desc: A medieval pickpocket who escapes the noose becomes indebted to a shapeshifting knight and his star-crossed lover on a revenge quest to kill a bishop.

programme.title: The Majestic
programme.desc: Upon getting into a car accident, a Hollywood screenwriter develops amnesia and ends up in a small town, where he is mistaken for a missing war hero.

programme.title: Overnight Delivery
programme.desc: After mistakenly sending an angry letter to his girlfriend, a college student gets help from a stripper as he races against time to stop the delivery.

programme.title: True Stories
programme.desc: David Byrne whimsically pays homage to the mythical small Texas town of Virgil.

programme.title: Strange Brew
programme.desc: When a deranged Brewmeister plans to turn beer into a mind-control device, two friends must save the world.

programme.title: Monkey Trouble
programme.desc: Eva's (Thora Birch) mom (Mimi Rodgers) is obsessively neat; her dad's (Christopher McDonald) allergic to fur. But when a thieving organ grinder's (Harvey Keitel) monkey escapes, Eva bonds with a new friend. As much as she tries, Eva can't housebreak her new pet ... or break him of his training to steal. And Eva's getting the blame in this heartwarming family comedy.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pluto Nash
programme.desc: In the year 2087, a bold casino owner, his android bodyguard and a beautiful, aspiring singer are on the run from a millionaire gangster on the moon.

programme.title: Chaos Theory
programme.desc: An obsessively organized man learns that hes sterile and that his daughter was fathered by his best friend.

programme.title: Hot to Trot
programme.desc: A hapless stockbroker meets a talking horse, and everything changes.

programme.title: Fandango
programme.desc: Five young men about to graduate from college, take one last trip before facing their lives as adults.

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: To win a womans heart, Dylan kidnaps her dog with a plan to find him but a jealous ex, a missing ring and Neil Diamond throw a wrench in the works.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew in WWII must contend with thirsty Nazi troops while crossing the Sahara in search of a fabled water well.

programme.title: Race the Sun
programme.desc: A teacher at a high school in Hawaii and her previously unmotivated students find new purpose through a solar-powered science fair project.

programme.title: Brian's Song
programme.desc: Mekhi Phifer and Sean Maher star in the remake of the classic sports drama about two NFL contenders whose friendship is tragically cut short.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: Based on the book by Philippe Petit.

programme.title: The Hollars
programme.desc: John must return to his small hometown for his mothers brain surgery, which brings up old family issues and painful, unresolved feuds.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Sister Mary Explains It All
programme.desc: A confrontation between three former students and a nun forever changes their lives as the students turn the dogmatic nun's teachings on their head.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: What begins as a casual chat turns into something more complex, as a romance blooms between a high school junior and a senior on his way to college.

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Murphy's Romance
programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorce with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: Mary Reilly
programme.desc: An innocent domestic worker comes to realize her employer and benefactor, Dr. Jekyll, is hiding a horrifying secret involving his curious assistant.

programme.title: The Waterdance
programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: Predestination
programme.desc: When a secret governmental time traveling agency attempts to stop future criminals from their transgressions, a new kind of chaos ensues.

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: Based on the book by Philippe Petit.

programme.title: The Hollars
programme.desc: John must return to his small hometown for his mothers brain surgery, which brings up old family issues and painful, unresolved feuds.

programme.title: Random Hearts
programme.desc: After losing their loved ones in a plane crash, a cop and a congresswoman discover their spouses were having an affair with each other.

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: Based on the play by William Inge.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: Salome (1953)
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
programme.desc: Nick Romano (James Darren) lives in a poor tenement building on the south side of Chicago with his well-meaning but drug-addicted mother, Nellie (Shelley Winters). She encourages him to pursue his piano-playing talent in hopes that it will bring him a better life. Nellie's neighbors, like the alcoholic ex-lawyer (Burl Ives) who secretly loves her, help her in keeping Nick away from Louie, the resident drug dealer. But a chance meeting between Nick and Louie could change things forever.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Vctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an expos of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiance (Luz Mrquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Scalplock
programme.desc: A frontier gambler (Dale Robertson) wins a railroad in a card game and has to keep it going as people try to take it away from him.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: Savage Pampas
programme.desc: To tame the plains of Argentina, dominated by bandits and Indigenous warriors, an army captain brings in a party of women to keep his soldiers happy.

programme.title: The Last Rebel
programme.desc: Two Confederates (Joe Namath, Jack Elam) save a man's (Woody Strode) life and cause trouble in 1865 Missouri.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: It's the day of the Gamma Fair, but Sarah doesn't want to go. Bundy rescues Kappa Psi Psi's bachelorette auction, but pays for it later.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: A Missed Connection
programme.desc: After sparks fly with a woman on a train platform, a photographer posts a missed connection in the newspaper.

programme.title: The Love Issue
programme.desc: A beauty editor finds a fake boyfriend when her ex-boyfriend (and boss) gets engaged.

programme.title: Love's Secret Ingredient
programme.desc: The owner of a struggling market teams up with a celebrity chef to revive each others reputations.

programme.title: A Royal Makeover

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: On May 23, 1999, world-renowned wrestler Owen Hart fell to his death, plummeting 78 feet from the ceiling of an arena during a live television broadcast; he had been due to make an entrance, flying into the ring from the rafters.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: In Richland County, SC a fleeing driver crashes into a building while officers in Daytona Beach, FL investigate multiple shootings likely linked to the same suspect. Officers respond after a minor is shot in Toledo, OH and Hazen, AR officers are called to a house fire.

programme.desc: Toledo, OH officers investigate a reported fight while officers in Daytona Beach, FL stop a reckless driver. Richland County, SC officers pursue a shooting suspect and a Berkeley County, SC officer spots a passenger attempting to throw drugs out of a car window.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A late 1800s Penny Farthing bicycle is delivered to the shop needing a major restoration; Rick implements an employee of the month award; the guys work on a 1930s parlour stove.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A hacked up 1970s Harley-Davidson golf cart is dropped off at the shop; a vintage 1950s toy horse pedal cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Harrison arrives at the shop looking for a birthday present for his son.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1970s wet bike is brought into the shop; Rick tests a loud-mouthed new painter in a high stakes shop competition against Horny Mike.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick attempts to restore a 1960s three-wheeled Marketeer Golf Cart for the Pawn Stars; a customer drops off an extremely rare Hopalong Cassidy bicycle from the 1950s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1952 powerboat ride splashes into the shop; Rick tackles a 1940s child's tricycle for a Las Vegas museum.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 100-year-old mutoscope comes into the shop; Ron and Tyler spot a tarnished tandem bike at a client's house.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the crew work to restore a miniature Model T; a fire fighter brings in a vintage 1930s forest field service phone.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Chumley from "Pawn Stars" comes into the shop with a 1950s Murray pedal car and a specific vision for how he wants it restored; the crew works to fix up a 1965 Honda Superhawk that hasn't run since the 1980s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A customer brings by a disassembled 1959 BMW motorcycle with a side car for Rick to restore; the guys work on an antique pencil dispenser that will be auctioned off for a special cause; Rick is visited by a picker who has some unique items for sale.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is contacted by Nellis Air Force Base to restore their replica of an F-105 fighter jet; Tyler's skills are challenged when a unique Buffalo Forge Grill is brought into the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1960s Pak Trak hunting scooter is brought to the shop; Rick calls Danny The Count to check out the unique dirt mobile; Kelly purchases a classic Mosrite guitar for Brettly's birthday.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: An amusement park ride is restored; a heavily damaged safe could hold hidden treasures.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: With actor, retired pro football player and multi-title World Wrestling Champion Bill Goldberg on his way to the shop, the ghouls have very little time to complete the last minute details on his 1968 Plymouth GTX convertible.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Josh, Will and Allysa make progress with the Firepower 'Cuda's bodywork; Dave continues his work on the 1971 Dodge Challenger R/T.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The 1-of-1 ever built, 1969 Hemi Road Runner convertible returns to the lift; the ghouls scramble to finish work on the vehicle before the owner arrives.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny acquires a '62 Caddy which he hopes will be a huge flip. Ryan devises a secret plan for the car behind Danny's back, but when Danny finds out there's some explaining to do.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to restore a family heirloom '67 Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A high end client has his heart set on a tricked out '68 Camaro, so Danny sets out to find one and give it the world class Counts Kustoms treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Like in the cartoons, the Plymouth Road Runner has always eluded Danny.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny attempts to create a baddass muscle car from a 4-door sedan, and a one of a kind couch from the tail end of a Plymouth Roadrunner.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and his crew look at some of the most classic rides in the history of Counting Cars: a museum worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon; a 1960 Cadillac coupe; a tricked out '35 Ford pickup street rod; a 1953 Henry J Corsair.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: "Engine Whisperer" Doc has a cool '67 Firebird he's been working on. While he's a mechanical maestro under the hood, his paint skills are lacking so he enlists Ryan.

programme.desc: Danny acquires a '62 Caddy which he hopes will be a huge flip. Ryan devises a secret plan for the car behind Danny's back, but when Danny finds out there's some explaining to do.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to restore a family heirloom '67 Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A high end client has his heart set on a tricked out '68 Camaro, so Danny sets out to find one and give it the world class Counts Kustoms treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Like in the cartoons, the Plymouth Road Runner has always eluded Danny.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny attempts to create a baddass muscle car from a 4-door sedan, and a one of a kind couch from the tail end of a Plymouth Roadrunner.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and his crew look at some of the most classic rides in the history of Counting Cars: a museum worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon; a 1960 Cadillac coupe; a tricked out '35 Ford pickup street rod; a 1953 Henry J Corsair.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: "Engine Whisperer" Doc has a cool '67 Firebird he's been working on. While he's a mechanical maestro under the hood, his paint skills are lacking so he enlists Ryan.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: With actor, retired pro football player and multi-title World Wrestling Champion Bill Goldberg on his way to the shop, the ghouls have very little time to complete the last minute details on his 1968 Plymouth GTX convertible.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Josh, Will and Allysa make progress with the Firepower 'Cuda's bodywork; Dave continues his work on the 1971 Dodge Challenger R/T.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The 1-of-1 ever built, 1969 Hemi Road Runner convertible returns to the lift; the ghouls scramble to finish work on the vehicle before the owner arrives.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers try to put the storm behind them and get back to work; Darrell makes a startling discovery; Stump Branch greenhorn Michael goes missing; Jay struggles to muster his troops without phone service; the Pihl crew bails out one of its own.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.desc: At Rygaard, the bosses clash over greenhorn Brad. Meanwhile, at the Pihl team, Dwayne is forced to do the job of a greenhorn.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has to deal with Kimber's eyes on a competitor; Ivy brings a full truck, hoping for a second haul; Dusty unpacks what could be the ultimate assistant; Rene's hunch serves him well, putting together one of his greatest profits.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lancaster turns into Ivy's honeypot, so everyone had better watch out or they might get stung; Lisa plans to use her brain when selecting lockers; Dusty and Tollbooth Lupe do a mitzvah.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Hesperia, Calif., Mary's transportation troubles lead to her teaming up with Kenny and taking him out to pasture; Darrell shows the next generation of Gambler how it's done; the Vegas Ladies' mid-century style lets them write their own ticket.

programme.desc: Dan and Laura hope for better units and better buyers; Rene tries to capitalize on warehouse sales and scoots away with a deal; Jarrod treats himself to a spa day; Darrell reflects on what it means to buy lockers full of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.desc: Emily deals with an all-male day in Paramount, Calif.; Justin seeks Ivy's guidance with his vintage Cadillac parts; Kenny speaks up during the auction, and quickly regrets it.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Less is mostly more in Brea; Rene swings for the fences on a costly gamble; Brandi has to dig through trash but really puts her heart into it nonetheless; Ivy and Pops clear up confusion over a massive, mysterious mechanism.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy hopes to land a high-roller locker while Rene attempts to play it cool; Mary stands firm against the competition; Dan and Dave lose their temper.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell's pupil has a gothic graduation; Kenny uncovers a new career opportunity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Victorville, Calif., Ivy takes it easy and lets Ivy Jr. run the operation; Kenny feels run-down and his lack of focus lands him a locker, though there's a pleasant surprise in the end; Mary, Shana and Edwina just can't seem to make anything stick.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tries to reclaim the title of King of Whittier but has trouble amassing any shillings; Ivy & Ivy brave the cold to find their fortunes; Lisa finally graduates to full-fledged buyer, finding an unlikely mentor along the way.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Palm Springs, Calif., in search of higher-end goods; Kenny tries to amp up the profit on an otherwise unimpressive unit; Rene sees quick potential where others don't; Brandi and Bozek try to keep their gains from squirming away.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists the shop to update a '32 Roadster for his wife's birthday.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave must find and transform a 1967 GTO for a secret client.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The final details on the 1967 GTO come together to create a masterpiece.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team start a one-of-a-kind build with a 1964 Ford Ranchero.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave struggles to find the perfect name for the Ranchero build.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A father-daughter team wants a little sister for the '65 Safari Bus.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An old build is back for an interior revamp and a new name.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave tries to envision what the Hummer H2 might look like in the future.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The team tries to correct flaws in a Mercedes Gullwing kit car.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '41 Chevy rolls in for a trunk-lid fix, but things go south quickly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Mercedes Gullwing build finally comes to an epic conclusion.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew swap the chassis of a 1955 Chevrolet Nomad.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A show in Stockton wants Dave to be a judge and to present a special award.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '63 Corvette gets an LSX engine, a larger transmission and new paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew stretches a '62 Corvette and makes some other improvements.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Vinnie Massaro is back looking to build the biggest, baddest Mopar ever.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Metal work on the '67 Coronet is done, so now it's on to the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1941 Chevy is finished in the metal shop and ready for paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is challenged restoring a 1964 Cadillac to its original condition.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the Kindig team add a tubbed bed and slivered Camaro bumpers to a classic Chevrolet C/K C-10.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The guys need to shake down a 1962 Corvette and make some design adjustments to a '55 Mercedes Gullwing; Kevin hunts for new ideas and rare finds in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A road warrior from Alaska arrives at the shop to add some improvements to an already solid build; to enhance performance, a new exhaust and tips are custom fabricated as well as a new set of wheels, tires and a custom interior.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build, but things get complicated after the car is completely stripped.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pontiac Tempest build continues as bodywork is completed and Dave has designed a killer new color; Kevin shows off his powder-coating skills on a custom chassis.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave restarts work on a 1948 GMC truck that has been sitting in the back of the shop for three years.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin take the '67 Coronet, '55 Gullwing and '63 Corvette to a car show in Columbus, Ohio, where they will compete for street rod of the year.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave loves anything VW, and he finds a deal for a rare Transporter pickup that is too good to pass up. With a few modifications, he will finish the build, but then his real dilemma begins - whether to keep it or auction it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A car from Kindigs past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Karmann Ghia aficionado wants some very specific upgrades for his new purchase. Custom trim, wheels, lowered stance, new paint and new upholstery are some of the items that will give this car a new lease on life.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The pieces that have arrived at the shop are allegedly for a Nova, but the only thing recognizable is the body; the challenge will be to piece car back together and get the body ready so the client can paint it himself.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client wants his '48 GMC to be Dave's baddest build ever, but when he throws Dave a curveball, it threatens the entire project. Celebrating 20 years in business, Kindig-It hosts a custom car show featuring a slew of past builds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has decided that the time is right to design his own concept car from scratch; it's a huge job that involves all the different departments in the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: All the Concept Corvette's elements are built and assembled, but Dave needs to find a buyer; a rock 'n' roll icon brings his '34 Ford coupe to the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette careens into much more after Dave upsells the client on a couple of design features, and the crew finds some damage underneath the original paint; the owner of an iconic Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists the shop to update a '32 Roadster for his wife's birthday.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave must find and transform a 1967 GTO for a secret client.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The final details on the 1967 GTO come together to create a masterpiece.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team start a one-of-a-kind build with a 1964 Ford Ranchero.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave struggles to find the perfect name for the Ranchero build.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A father-daughter team wants a little sister for the '65 Safari Bus.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An old build is back for an interior revamp and a new name.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave tries to envision what the Hummer H2 might look like in the future.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The team tries to correct flaws in a Mercedes Gullwing kit car.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '41 Chevy rolls in for a trunk-lid fix, but things go south quickly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Mercedes Gullwing build finally comes to an epic conclusion.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew swap the chassis of a 1955 Chevrolet Nomad.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A show in Stockton wants Dave to be a judge and to present a special award.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '63 Corvette gets an LSX engine, a larger transmission and new paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew stretches a '62 Corvette and makes some other improvements.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Vinnie Massaro is back looking to build the biggest, baddest Mopar ever.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Metal work on the '67 Coronet is done, so now it's on to the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1941 Chevy is finished in the metal shop and ready for paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is challenged restoring a 1964 Cadillac to its original condition.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the Kindig team add a tubbed bed and slivered Camaro bumpers to a classic Chevrolet C/K C-10.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The guys need to shake down a 1962 Corvette and make some design adjustments to a '55 Mercedes Gullwing; Kevin hunts for new ideas and rare finds in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A road warrior from Alaska arrives at the shop to add some improvements to an already solid build; to enhance performance, a new exhaust and tips are custom fabricated as well as a new set of wheels, tires and a custom interior.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build, but things get complicated after the car is completely stripped.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pontiac Tempest build continues as bodywork is completed and Dave has designed a killer new color; Kevin shows off his powder-coating skills on a custom chassis.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave restarts work on a 1948 GMC truck that has been sitting in the back of the shop for three years.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin take the '67 Coronet, '55 Gullwing and '63 Corvette to a car show in Columbus, Ohio, where they will compete for street rod of the year.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave loves anything VW, and he finds a deal for a rare Transporter pickup that is too good to pass up. With a few modifications, he will finish the build, but then his real dilemma begins - whether to keep it or auction it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A car from Kindigs past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Karmann Ghia aficionado wants some very specific upgrades for his new purchase. Custom trim, wheels, lowered stance, new paint and new upholstery are some of the items that will give this car a new lease on life.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The pieces that have arrived at the shop are allegedly for a Nova, but the only thing recognizable is the body; the challenge will be to piece car back together and get the body ready so the client can paint it himself.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client wants his '48 GMC to be Dave's baddest build ever, but when he throws Dave a curveball, it threatens the entire project. Celebrating 20 years in business, Kindig-It hosts a custom car show featuring a slew of past builds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has decided that the time is right to design his own concept car from scratch; it's a huge job that involves all the different departments in the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: All the Concept Corvette's elements are built and assembled, but Dave needs to find a buyer; a rock 'n' roll icon brings his '34 Ford coupe to the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette careens into much more after Dave upsells the client on a couple of design features, and the crew finds some damage underneath the original paint; the owner of an iconic Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: So what does a bondsman do when he learns that the felon he's bonded out is booked on an afternoon flight to Florida? Especially when over $140,000 is at stake? If you're Dog, you 911 the team and race to Honolulu International.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A big heart can be a problem for a bail bondsman and today's hunt is a case in point. Dog gave a break to a young man with a drug problem who promised to enter drug rehab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that looks can be deceiving and today's hunt makes this point crystal clear. The fugitive is pretty, petite, and trouble. She stands accused of settling an argument with the help of a box cutter.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today was once an upstanding member of his community. Now with no home, no job and the law on his trail, this middle-aged exile from middle-class society is using the cold end of an ice pipe to soothe his troubled soul.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is hunting a man known as "The Godfather of Waikiki". The bond is small, Dog and Beth bailed him out as a courtesy, but now he is refusing to go to court. If Dog doesn't bring him in, it could cost him more than money.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after Virginia, a hard-to-find lawbreaker. He gets a tip that a pickup truck will be going to Virginia's house. In true private-eye fashion.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after a fugitive named Tracy who lives in a homeless shelter, but the shelter's staff is uncooperative, and the two sides get into an angry confrontation that forces Dog to temporarily back off.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's feeling lucky, so he's going to try to capture two women in one day. The first, Moani, has "crazy" tattooed on her neck and is facing drug charges. Dog and the team will have to chase her down at the beach if they're going to bring her in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows very little about Peter, but what he does know, he doesn't like! Not only is he currently facing two counts of second degree sexual assault, he's racked up numerous restraining orders over the years.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog answers two very different calls for help from women. In the first case, he helps Leland protect Maria, who's being threatened by her violent husband.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kristine had a string of gambling and forgery charges before she jumped bail leaving Dog "holding the bag" -- in this case a $20,000 bond. Now it's time for Dog to call in some chits of his own.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The co-signer on this bond is seven months pregnant, and she says that the man she bailed out has threatened her safety and has been running amok on the streets. Now Dog and the posse have got to revoke John's bail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog always wants to share the wisdom he has collected on the streets with the fugitives he captures. But today he's going to do double duty! His son-in-law Travis (and trainee bondsman) is also in need of some knowledge.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks, but what if it's The Dog doing the teaching? Today's target is wanted on domestic abuse charges, but when Dog discovers she works for an escort service he opts for a new twist on an old ruse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What starts out as a perfect day for Dog turns ugly fast. He and Beth just bought bunnies for their kids, and Dog is enjoying helping them learn to care for their new pets. But duty calls and this is a tough case to fathom.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is hunting a man known as "The Godfather of Waikiki". The bond is small, Dog and Beth bailed him out as a courtesy, but now he is refusing to go to court. If Dog doesn't bring him in, it could cost him more than money.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kristine had a string of gambling and forgery charges before she jumped bail leaving Dog "holding the bag" -- in this case a $20,000 bond. Now it's time for Dog to call in some chits of his own.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The co-signer on this bond is seven months pregnant, and she says that the man she bailed out has threatened her safety and has been running amok on the streets. Now Dog and the posse have got to revoke John's bail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog always wants to share the wisdom he has collected on the streets with the fugitives he captures. But today he's going to do double duty! His son-in-law Travis (and trainee bondsman) is also in need of some knowledge.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks, but what if it's The Dog doing the teaching? Today's target is wanted on domestic abuse charges, but when Dog discovers she works for an escort service he opts for a new twist on an old ruse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What starts out as a perfect day for Dog turns ugly fast. He and Beth just bought bunnies for their kids, and Dog is enjoying helping them learn to care for their new pets. But duty calls and this is a tough case to fathom.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog juggles his job and family responsibilities at the same time. He leads the search for Robert, a low-level drug dealer who makes money by selling hedge clippings as marijuana and broken Macadamia nuts as crack.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has problems when he goes to a small town on the Big Island of Hawaii to track down a fugitive. In a small town, everyone knows everyone else's business, making it impossible for Dog to hunt in secret.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team really have their hands full when they go after a tough guy named Nunu, who leads them on a chase through apartment complexes and a shopping mall before he's finally captured. But Dog is charmed by Nunu's unquenchable

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog leads the team on another adrenaline-filled chase in Denver. The fugitive, Robert, has a habit of address-hopping that makes him a difficult target, but Dog refuses to give up and finally tracks Robert down in his latest hideaway.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain. This morning, he takes the toddler for a spin around the yard in her little red wagon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the team hunts for Steven, a fugitive with a history of domestic abuse, they seek help from his girlfriend, who's been a victim of his abuse. Meanwhile, Beth trains for a 5K race to help raise awareness about domestic abuse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth are finally getting married! They've been together for more than ten years but Dog is determined, as he puts it, to "marry his common law wife the Christian way." There are big nuptials planned on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What better way for Dog to start his morning, than at an elementary school Career Day, inspiring a new generation of potential bounty hunters? After giving a rousing speech to an audience of enthusiastic grade-schoolers, Dog catches up with an old friend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Halloween, and before Dog and Beth can help the kids carve their pumpkins, they have some business to attend to. It involves knocking on doors and meeting the neighbors but instead of hunting for treats they're on the search for a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: No one becomes a bondsman overnight and even the members of Dog's team know there is always more to learn. So when Duane Lee cuts a felon a little too much slack about checking-in and then goes missing, Duane Lee knows he's gonna get schooled.
